HarValgfrieFelt: All fields must be filled in, except fields marked with (optional).
ValidationMessage.InFuture: The date you chose is in the future.
ValidationMessage.ValidDate: You have entered a text that is not a date, the date must be entered in the format dd.mm.yyyy
ValidationMessage.OlderThan6months: The date you chose is older than 6 months.
ValidationMessage.KanIkkeVære3UkerFraIda: The date cannot be earlier than 3 weeks from today.
ValidationMessage.DuMåVæreIUke22: You can apply at the earliest when you are in the 22nd week of pregnancy.
ValidationMessage.IdagEllerTidligere: The date must be today or earlier.
ValidationMessage.FødselsdatoMåVæreFørOm: The date must be after the birth date.
ValidationMessage.OmsorgsovertakelseKanI: The date cannot be later than 15 years after the child was born.
HvorforSpørNAVOmDette.Info.Tittel: Why does NAV ask about this?
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.HvaGjelder: What applies to {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}}?
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.HvaGjelder.Required: You must answer what applies to {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} before proceeding.
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.Jobber: Have worked 6 of the last 10 months and have earned more than 59,310 kr last year
Arbeidssituasjon.Jobber.Infoboks.HarJobb: If you have worked 6 of the last 10 months and have earned more than 59,310 kr last year, you are typically entitled to parental benefits.
Arbeidssituasjon.Jobber.Infoboks.HarRett: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} will be entitled to parental benefits
Arbeidssituasjon.Infoboks.HarIkkeRettTil: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You are } other {{navn} is}} not entitled to parental benefits
Arbeidssituasjon.Ufør.Infoboks.ErUfør: Since {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} are disabled, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} will not be entitled to parental benefits.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ufør.Infoboks.LesMer: On NAV's website, you can read more about the rules that apply if {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} is receiving disability benefits.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ingen.Infoboks.ManHarIk: If you have not worked 6 of the last 10 months and have not earned more than 59,310 kr, you are not entitled to parental benefits.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ingen.Infoboks.Engangss: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} might be entitled to a lump-sum grant instead. You can use NAV's guide for lump-sum grant or parental benefits to learn more.
Arbeidssituasjon.AndreForelder: Has {navn} worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than 59,310 kr last year?
Arbeidssituasjon.AndreForelder.Required: You must answer if {navn} has worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than 59 310 kr last year before proceeding.
Arbeidssituasjon.Forelder: Have you worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than 59,310 kr last year?
Arbeidssituasjon.Forelder.Required: You must answer if you have worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than 59 310 kr last year before proceeding.
FlereForsørgereBarnehageplass.KommuneTek: You do not apply for a childcare place at NAV, but in the municipality where you live. The date is used for your own part, to see how many days you potentially stand without parental benefits before the child is in childcare.
FlereForsørgereBarnehageplass.DatoTekst: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the child being born {dato}, and that you apply for a childcare place the year the child turns 1.
FlereForsørgereBarnehageplass.DatoTittel: You are entitled to a childcare place from {dato}
FlereForsørgereBarnehageplass.DatoTekstT: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the child being born on the due date {dato}, and that you apply for a childcare place the year the child turns 1.
FlereForsørgereBarnehageplass.BarnehageT: You can get a childcare place before this date
Several municipalities have their own rules that allow you to get a place in childcare before the date. You must check this on your municipality's website.
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.KommuneTeks: You do not apply for a childcare place at NAV, but in the municipality where you live. The date is used for your own part, to see how many days you potentially stand without parental benefits before the child is in childcare.
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.DatoTekst: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the child being born {dato}, and that you apply for a childcare place the year the child turns 1.
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.DatoTittel: You are entitled to a childcare place from {dato}
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.DatoTekstTe: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the child being born on the due date {dato}, and that you apply for a childcare place the year the child turns 1.
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.BarnehageTi: You can get a childcare place before this date
AleneforsørgerBarnehageplass.BarnehageTe: Several municipalities have their own rules that allow you to get a place in childcare before the date. You must check this on your municipality's website.
FordelingSteg.Infoboks.HvordanFordeleTit: How to distribute the weeks you will be at home
FordelingSteg.Infoboks.HvordanFordeleTek: Since both of you will receive parental benefits, the period consists of three parts, one for each parent and a joint period. You can share the joint period between you.
FordelingSteg.FordelingTittel: How do you want to distribute the joint period?
FordelingSteg.FordelingTittel.Required: You must answer how you want to distribute the joint period before proceeding.
FordelingsdetaljerPanel.Infoboks.HvisBar: This is if the child {erFødt, select, true {was born {dato}} other {is born on due date}} and you take leave continuously from {erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {three weeks before the due date} other {the due date} }, the leave can look like this with the distribution you chose:.

This is if the children {erFødt, select, true {were born {dato}} other {is born on due date}} and you take leave continuously from {erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {three weeks before the due date} other {the due date} }, the leave can look like this with the distribution you chose:.
FordelingsdetaljerPanel.Infoboks.HvisAdo: This is if you take over the care of the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} the {dato} and you take leave continuously from the takeover, the leave can look like this with the distribution you chose:.
HvemPlanleggerSteg.HvemPlanlegger.Requir: You must answer who plans before proceeding.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.HvorLangPer: You can choose between 49 weeks and 59 weeks of parental benefits{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {} other {, and the choice applies for both}}. If you choose 49 weeks, you get 100 % parental benefits, while if you choose 59 weeks, the payment is reduced to 80 %.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareEnPa: When only the {hvem} is entitled to parental benefits
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareMorH: When only the {hvem} is entitled to parental benefits, the {hvem} gets the entire parental benefit period.
There are no requirements for what the {hvem} does when the {hvem2} takes out parental benefits.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.KunEnAvFedr: When only one of the fathers is to receive parental benefits.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareEnHa: When only one parent is entitled to parental benefits, that parent can receive the entire period of parental benefits.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.ManFårEnDel: There's a portion of parental benefits you can use without any requirements for the other father, and a portion where it's required that the other father is in an approved activity while you're at home with the child.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareFarH: When only the {hvem, select, true {father} other {co-mother}} is entitled to parental benefits, he can get the entire period of parental benefits, except for 9 weeks reserved for the mother around the birth.

As a {hvem}, you have a part of the parental benefits you can use without any requirements for the mother, and a part where it is required that the mother is in approved activity while you are at home with the child.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.HvorLangPeriode: How long period of parental benefits do you want?
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.HvorLangPeriode.Requ: You must answer how long period of parental benefits you want before proceeding.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.SisteDagTit: The last day with parental benefits can be {dato}
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.SisteDagTek: If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born on the due date{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from {erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {three weeks before the due date} other {the due date}}.}}
If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born {dato}{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from the birth.}}
If you take over the care of the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} the {dato} {kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from that date.}}
{uker} of the {uker2} weeks can be used by the {hvem} without requirements for the mother.
{uker} of the {uker2} weeks can be used by the {hvem} if the mother is in approved activity.
OmBarnetSteg.HvorMange: How many children are you expecting?
OmBarnetSteg.HvorMange.Required: You must answer how many children {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {you}} {erFødsel, select, true {are expecting} other {will be taking care of}} before proceeding.
OmBarnetSteg.Adopsjon.HvorMange: How many children will you be taking over care for?
OmBarnetSteg.HvaGjelder.Required: You must answer what applies to you before proceeding.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks: Since you have chosen birth, we assume that you will have children through surrogacy, where one is the biological father and the other adopts the child as a step-parent.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks.DenSomErBio: The one who is the biological father of the child can take the entire parental leave period. The other father can receive parental leave if he adopts the child as a step-parent, provided there are still days left in the parental leave period when the adoption is approved.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks.LesMer: Read more about this on NAV's pages about parental benefits.
OmBarnetSteg.Adopsjon.ForeldrepengerInfo: You can apply for parental benefits now.
In the case of adoption, you can apply for parental benefits once you have the date of care transfer.
You can start the parental benefits period from the care transfer.
Adopsjon.Overtakelsesdato: When do you take over care for the {flereBarn, select, true {children} other {child}}?
Adopsjon.Fødselsdato: When was the{flereBarn, select, true {oldest child} other {child}} born?
Fødsel.ErFødt: {antallBarn, select, 1 {Has the child} other {Have the children}} been born?
Fødsel.ErFødt.Required: You must answer if {antallBarn, select, 1 {the child} other {the children}} {antallBarn, select, 1 {has} other {have}} been born before proceeding.
Fødselsdato.Required: You must answer what the the date of birth is before proceeding.
Termindato.Required: You must answer what the due date is before proceeding.
Overtakelsesdato.Required: You must answer what the date of care transfer is before proceeding.
ErIkkeFødtPanel.ForeldrepengerInfo: You can apply for parental benefits from {dato}
You can apply for parental benefits three months before the due date.
NAV recommends applying about 4 weeks before you plan to start the leave{erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true{, which is often three weeks before the due date for mothers.} other {.}}

{erFar, select, true {Fathers} other {Co-mothers}} often have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can apply for parental benefits from NAV for these two weeks.
ErIkkeFødtPanel.UnderTreMndTilTerminInfo: Since it's less than 3 months to the due date, you can apply for parental benefits at NAV
ErIkkeFødtPanel.TerminErForbi: Since it's passed the due date, you can apply for parental benefits at NAV
ErIkkeFødtPanel.UnderTreMndTilTermin: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} can apply for parental benefits now to take leave three weeks before the due date.
ErFødtPanel.Fødselsdato: When was {antallBarn, select, 1 {the child} other {the oldest child}} born?
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTittel: If you haven't applied for parental benefits yet, you can do it now.
ErFødtPanel.Født.Infoboks.ManKanSøkeTilb: You can apply for parental benefits up to three months back in time.
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.NAVanbefa: NAV recommends applying about 4 weeks before you plan to start the leave{erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {, which is often three weeks before the due date for mothers.} other {.}}
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.toFørsteU: {erFar, select, true {Fathers} other {Co-mothers}} often have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {erFar, select, true {father} other {co-mother}} can apply for parental benefits from NAV for these two weeks.
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTittel.EldreEnn: Since the child is older than three years you cannot apply for parental benefits
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.EldreEnnT: Parental benefits must be used before the child turns 3 years old.
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Ingress: The planner is for those who are on leave, expecting a child, and for those planning to have children.
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Underoverskrift: The planner consists of two parts:
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Trinn2: Then you can see what your leave might look like
OmPlanleggerenSteg.TaVarePå: By copying the link, you can save the result for later viewing or sharing.
PlanleggerForside.Label: Approx 5 min
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.IngenHarRettDe: You do not have the right to parental benefits
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.IngenHarRett: None of you have the right to parental benefits
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.BasertPåSvaren: Based on the answers {erAleneforsørger, select, true {your answers indicate you do not have} other {your answers indicate none of you have}} the right to parental benefits.
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.Engangsstønad: You may be entitled to a lump-sum grant, which is a one-time payment. You can find out in
the guide “Parental benefits or lump-sum grant”.
OppsummeringSteg.InformasjonPlanleggerEr: The planner is under development and will soon have more functionality!
The planner is under development and will soon have more functionality! If you wish to plan more in detail and move and change periods, you can use the application for parental benefits.
OppsummeringSteg.DereValgte: You chose {prosent} % over {antallUker} weeks with the distribution of the joint period with {uker} weeks for {hvem} and {uker2} weeks for {hvem2}.
OppgittInformasjon.InformasjonOmBarn: The {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} {erFødt, select, true {was born} other {has due date}} {dato}{erFødt, select, false {.} other { and due date was {dato2}.}}
OppgittInformasjon.InformasjonOmBarnAdop: The {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is up for adoption with care takeover {dato} and{antallBarn, select, 1 {} other { the oldest child}} was born {dato2}.
OppgittInformasjon.ArbeidssituasjonBegge: Both {navn} and {navn2} has had earnings 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than NOK 59,310 in the last year
OppgittInformasjon.Arbeidssituasjon: {navn} {arbeidssituasjon, select, jobber {has had earnings 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than NOK 59,310 in the last year} ufør {is disabled} other {has not had earnings 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than NOK 59,310 in the last year}}
OppgittInformasjon.ArbeidssituasjonAnnen: {navn} {arbeidssituasjon, select, jobber {has had earnings 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than NOK 59,310 in the last year} other {har not had earnings 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than NOK 59,310 in the last year}}
OppgittInformasjon.LengdeOgFordeling: Length {kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {} other { and distribution}}
OppgittInformasjon.FordelingOptionsMedUk: You chose {prosent} % parental benefit over {uker} weeks{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other{ and distributes the joint period with {fellesuker} weeks for the {hvem} and {fellesuker2} weeks for the {hvem2}.}}
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.Utkast.Tekst: Here is a draft of what the leave can look like. When you apply, you can customize the plan to {erAleneforsørger, select, true {your} other {your}} needs.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.DereHarOp: You have indicated that only one of you is entitled to parental benefits.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.DenSomErB: The one who is the biological father can have parental benefits from birth, while the one who adopts the child as a step-parent must wait until the adoption is approved before having parental benefits.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.HvisDetEr: If only the one who is adopting the child as a step-parent is to receive parental benefits, you will be entitled to {uker} weeks instead of {ukerFødsel} weeks at 100% and {uker2} weeks at 80% parental benefits.
OversiktSteg.UkerUtenAktivitetskrav: {hvem}, {uker} weeks without requirements for the mother
OversiktSteg.UkerMedAktivitetskrav: {hvem}, {uker} weeks with requirements for the mother
UforutsetteEndringer.UforutsetteEndringe: If one becomes sick during their period with parental benefits
If one becomes sick when receiving parental benefits
The other parent can take over the period with parental benefits when one is sick. The parent who is sick usually receives sick pay instead of parental benefits.
If one is sick, they usually receive sick pay instead of parental benefits.
If the mother becomes sick in the first six weeks with parental benefits

The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother, and it is generally not possible to move them to a later date. The exception is if the mother becomes sick and cannot care for the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}}. Then the {hvem} can take over the period.

The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother, and it is generally not possible to move them to a later date. The exception is if the mother becomes sick and cannot care for the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}}.
If one has a new child before three years have passed
If one has a new child before three years have passed, one must use up the parental benefits before starting with parental benefits for the next child.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.Tekst: There's a lot you can change in the plan. When applying for parental benefits, one will set up their own plan, adapted to holidays and other needs.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.FørTermin.Tekst: The mother has three weeks that can only be used before birth. If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born before the due date, the mother starts using weeks from her quota. The remaining part of these three weeks is erased. If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born after the due date, the joint period is being used until birth when the mother starts on her quota.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.DeFørsteSeksUkene.Teks: The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother and locked to this time. Often the {hvem}s have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can use parental benefits in these two weeks.
The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother and locked to this time.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.LeggeTilFerie.Tekst: If {erAlenesøker, select, true {you're not} other {neither of the parents are}} taking parental benefits, you can add periods without parental benefits, where you, for example, receive holiday pay from the employer.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.JobbeSamtidig.Tekst: You can work part-time while receiving partial parental benefits, and the period with parental benefits will then last longer.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.PermisjonSamtidig.Teks: Both parents can be at home simultaneously with up to 150 % parental benefits. This is possible from week 7 after birth, if one parent uses the joint period while the other uses their own quota.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.ToUkerRundtFødsel.Teks: Often {hvem}s have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can use parental benefits in these two weeks.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.LeggeTilFerie.TekstFar: If the {hvem} is not taking parental benefits, you can add a period without parental benefits, where one, for example, receives holiday pay from the employer.
